website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality litter that produces solid clumps without creating dust clouds or large messes.
pros: Clumps are as solid as concrete, making them simple to scoop
Dr. Elsey's formula has no overpowering fragrance
Effectively eliminates any undesirable cat smells for multiple days, even in a small apartment
Larger than normal grains ensure virtually no dust
The 40 pound bag should last roughly 2 months in a single cat household
cons: Formula can not be flushed down the toilet

website_summaries.verdict: A good buy if you want a natural litter and don't want to spend a lot of money; but the World's Best Cat Litter provides better odor control and overall quality.
pros: Delivers hard-clumping action in a natural clay formula
It's hypoallergenic and works in both mechanical and traditional litter boxes
Falls in the middle of the price spectrum
cons: Our testers noted that it doesn't seem to control odors very well
It also has the tendency to stick to cats' feet causing it to track

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best pet related purchase I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best pet related purchase I have ever made. For the first time in 10 years my house doesn't smell like cat poop. Update: still love, but beware if your cat's paw is wet the litter can form what I can only describe as concrete on their paw. You can imagine the fun we had soaking, chiseling, and cutting it off her hair for days.
customer_reviews.author: Christian K.

customer_reviews.title: ... been using this litter for quite sometime and have loved it but just recently noticed my cats tracking up ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this litter for quite sometime and have loved it but just recently noticed my cats tracking up my hardwood floors. I completely emptied all litter boxes and disinfected and filled with fresh litter to only find the tracking has not subsided. Horrible disappointment and not sure why the formula would change. I will be in search of another litter.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Duncan

customer_reviews.title: No longer worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Price has skyrocketed and the quality has declined. :( Too bad, this used to be my favorite brand. It would be nice to live in a world where companies weren't constantly trying to cut corners wherever they can, and instead, focused on delivering a consistently high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: OSchwartz

customer_reviews.title: They Changed It
customer_reviews.text: This litter used to be amazing - no dust, no tracking, good smell neutralization. It must have been too good to be profitable or something, because the new bags don't compare. This litter gets everywhere now, and doesn't last longer than 5, maybe 6 days (with one small tabby cat) without stinking something foul. Try something else, anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: Formula changed for the worst
customer_reviews.text: This used to be the best litter out there. No more. I noticed a couple of bags ago that it seemed quite different. Hoped it was a fluke bag but two more bags, and yes, it's now obvious the formula has changed. This litter used to consistently form very hard clumps, with little mess or odor. Now the clumps are soft, it sticks all over the sides of the litterbox, and it's one of the worst brands of litter available. How does one brand go from being best to worst so quickly? That's not my business, but my kitties are, so I won't be purchasing this very poor quality product again.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Price Has Doubled and product quality has changed.
customer_reviews.text: Well at first I loved this litter. I figured that I would continue using it but now that the price doubled and I noticed the reviews have gone down and not just due to the price, I guess I will stay away now. I suggest everyone else doing the same until Ultra gets this right again. Ultra, you most likely are going to loose money as your ratings are going down. Great job, fix your product, price and try again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ashley

customer_reviews.title: why so expensive suddenly?
customer_reviews.text: great litter but price has gone up about 250% since last month, same 40# bag. whaaa?
customer_reviews.author: ShakeyToo

customer_reviews.title: Doubled price
customer_reviews.text: Hands down my favorite litter! But in less than 6 months the price has doubled... Works great and it used to be cheap. BTW it's still only $17.50 at Petsmart so once that goes up I'll be looking for a cheaper litter.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Why can't there be consistence pricing OR subscription?
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this litter multiple times and it is great - the only thing that bothers me is that this litter gets everywhere but less than other brands. Another issue is the PRICE - I've seen this kitty litter jump up and down from 16 to 40 to 16 to 40. Why can't there be consistence pricing OR subscription? especially since it is something that people purchase regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Space Cat

customer_reviews.title: Love litter, hate amazon tripling price overnight after years of buying it
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the litter. Super ticked off at Amazon because price more than doubled in one month. The same happened with Organix dry cat food. How "odd" this happened when they joined with Whole Foods. So many products I bought for years at a great price from Amazon are now available only at the Whole foods whole paycheck price. I'm cancelling Prime when it expires.
customer_reviews.author: greetings

customer_reviews.title: Super Sludge is more like it.
customer_reviews.text: I hate to be a negative nellie and I really don't like writing bad reviews but this stuff is awful and I want to warn you before you waste your money. I bought a 40 lb bag of this stuff and second half of it in the garbage can. This says super clump but it should be super sludge. Yes, it will clump with feces but with urine is just becomes a sludge and sticks to the bottom of the litter box. I have broken one scoop trying to scrape the sludge off of the bottom of the litter box. Not sure how I will get the box clean but I will never use this again.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleFH

customer_reviews.title: Price doubled
customer_reviews.text: Good liter for the price but last time I bought it for $14. I was going to order it again but now it's $28. I think I'll shop around for a better price. All in all, a pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: bert

customer_reviews.title: 110% price increase in 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this litter several years ago because the brand I had been using was loaded with perfumes & the dust that settled on everything in my basement smelled like the litter. This litter is great, it controls litter box odors, is unscented & virtually no dust. That said, I am disappointed that it is no longer available on Prime. I was going to reorder today, the price of $28.77 was more than double the $13.68 I paid last month. I like this stuff, but not that much. I'll check back in a few days & if price hasn't come back down close to what I had been paying, I'll find something else.
customer_reviews.author: forrest

customer_reviews.title: I definitely don't recommend this litter!
customer_reviews.text: This litter claims "excellent clumping" I find that not true. Litter claims it prevents moisture from reaching & sticking to bottom. Not true. It's claims clumps will not break down. Not true. Worst claim of all "SUPERIOR ODOR CONTROL" ABSOLUTELY NOT TRUE. I have only ONE cat!
customer_reviews.author: GracieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 40 pound bag, formerly around $15, no longer available on Prime
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying the 40 pound bag of this litter since 2014, it works great. However, I'm disappointed that it is no longer available on Prime!!! :-( Why??? I regularly bought the 40 lb bag for ~15 bucks, now the 18 pound bag is $20... I just don't get it. Anybody have a good alternative? Any idea when the 40 lb bag will come back to Prime? I love the litter and the price it used to be! :-/
customer_reviews.author: Dan T. Man

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it at inflated prices!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice litter at $14 for 40 lb. Not worth it at all at current inflated prices. Let these guys eat the stuff if they're going to jack it up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gilvey

customer_reviews.title: WTH With the Price Fluctuations???
customer_reviews.text: I completely agree with recent reviews. Price waaay up, quality down. ISO new cat litter...
customer_reviews.author: Juliet H

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed with Amazon for not stocking this anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this cat litter for years. It's pretty much the best on the market. I paid $10.49 for 40 lbs in Oct. Now it's only available through 3rd party sellers at double or triple the price. What gives, Amazon? Getting this delivered for free (I go through 40 lbs every two weeks!) was totally worth it. Now I'm seriously considering giving up my Prime membership. Annoyed!!! PS.. For all of you having issues with it sticking like glue to the pan, just sprinkle a thin layer of baking soda on the pan before you put the litter in. The clumps will scoop right up.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Price more then doubled in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Price more then doubled in 3 months. Bought for $14 for 40lbs bag in Aug. Went to buy again and same product price is now over $35. Love product but won't be taken advantage of for price. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Petergazinya420

customer_reviews.title: Ethics lacking
customer_reviews.text: Up price by over triple after buzzfeed article. Avoid the unethical business
customer_reviews.author: Citra

customer_reviews.title: Price tripled overnight
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this litter and very happy with the great price until I went to re-order this morning and was shocked to see the price almost tripled since my last order. What gives??! I'll be making a switch but would consider using this again if the price goes back down. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: More Than Doubled in Price
customer_reviews.text: Been using this litter for three years and love it, but $27 for 40lb? I bought some not that long ago for $13. I’ll be buying this from Chewy instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcey

customer_reviews.title: Good litter, but why has the price doubled?
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 40 lb bag in early October for $13.68. The price for the same bag is now (10 weeks later) $26.99. Although I like this product, no cat litter is worth that kind of money. I am now buying it at Chewy.com.
customer_reviews.author: Pat M

customer_reviews.title: works great, but for whatever reason the price more than ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was something I used a few times, works great, but for whatever reason the price more than doubled!??!?! So, I'm now looking for something else again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome litter but it appears that the price hike is a push to Amazon branded litter
customer_reviews.text: This litter is amazing. It works fantastically. The apparent price hike and the sudden appearance of Amazon branded litter has my eyebrow raised, however. I will hit a brick and mortar for this in the future, for sure since the doubling in price is unacceptable and feels opportunistic in nature.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great cat litter but Way too high on the pricing.
customer_reviews.text: The litter works great and my cats love it. I have been ordering this litter for about 2 years now. My complaint is the price hike. It has gone up from 13.99 to 29.99 in 1 month. I don't know what Amazon is doing but this is not the first time I have seen major price hikes on products I order frequently. This is a good way to loose customers ! Wake up Amazon ! I am going back to Walmart. There pricing is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL77055

customer_reviews.title: New Formula is Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go-to litter for a number of years but either the formula has changed, or Amazon customers are getting a different quality. I switched brands after the price increase, but noticed it recently went back down so I purchased a bag. As other reviewers mentioned, it sticks to the sides and bottom of the litter box, hardens and is impossible to scrape up. It smells terrible too. Time for a switch.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Price is not stable!!
customer_reviews.text: Great litter - my cats love it. Only thing is - I bought this bag for 10 dollars and now has gone up to 25 and now 27. Not a big fan of the price fluctuating like that.
customer_reviews.author: Him

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Only one problem...the delivery person may not be happy with you.  ;)
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for over a year now, always purchasing from Amazon. I recommend it to all my friends that have cats, because it really is dust-free, and it clumps just as good,if not better, than the leading brick-and-mortar store cat litter. My cats had no problem switching directly over to this litter, I did not need to slowly acclimate them to it. The only issue I have had has been slightly disgruntled USPS delivery personnel, especially when I order 5 at a time. (see image) Our porch is 15' x 5'; plenty of room to put boxes to the side of the front door. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good product but now PRICEY!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! BUT, why has it gotten so expensive?? A couple months ago, I got the 40 pound bag for $13.68 and now it's $30?!! Why is the price so high now??
customer_reviews.author: Lance's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Is the new price for real??!!
customer_reviews.text: The price more than doubled in the last couple months...is this for real?? Not buying until it drops back down!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I just can not justify the price even though the product is nice. It's just too expensive for my budget
customer_reviews.text: This cat litter works really well; however, when I went to purchase it again the price went up drastically. I'm not sure if I received a promotional price the first time or not. I just can not justify the price even though the product is nice. It's just too expensive for my budget. Please offer at lower rates again.
customer_reviews.author: Littlecreek115

customer_reviews.title: New Ultra version doesn't clump as well, becomes unscoopable thick sludge
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a long time when it was called "Precious Cat" litter and it worked great. Low dust, clumped really well, easy to scoop. But now this new "Ultra" formulation doesn't perform well at all. The litter granules are larger, it doesn't form clumps, urine leaks to the bottom of the litter box and forms this dense thick sludge that is really hard to scoop out. Its like a totally different product. I can't recommend this anymore and sadly I'm on the hunt for a new brand. Dr. Elsey, if you're listening please return back to your original clumping formula! This product is inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dapertutto

customer_reviews.title: No longer a satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: We were satisfy with this product for a while; but, in the last 2 out of 3 purchases, we noticed that the litter sand was finer and dusty which makes it difficult to wrap around any substance and puts a lot of dust in the air. Here are some screenshots of our last purchase. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Luis E. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: FORMULA CHANGED! Now Ultra Sticky Clay
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this product. It was easy to clean up, and did a halfway decent job of covering the smell. But... I recently purchased a bag and the formula has changed! The litter now turns into an ultra sticky clay that makes it near impossible to get out of the box. It sticks like glue. If you don't have a metal scooper and Arnold Schwarzenegger's forearms, good luck getting the pee clumps out of the box. The litter now stays wet forever, causing smells to permeate. My cat also noticed the change, and started peeing in his bed. This is an even bigger problem! Take note Dr Elsey's: DO NOT CHANGE CAT LITTER FORMULAS! Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyDucati

customer_reviews.title: Why has the price doubled?
customer_reviews.text: I have use this litter for two years. It is the best I have found for containing smell and clumping. I bought this in April and the price was $17 so I can't understand why it is now $40.
customer_reviews.author: Alivia

customer_reviews.title: 40 lb. bag - You're On Your Own
customer_reviews.text: I love this 40 lb. clumping litter - good price, clumps well, etc. But I keep complaining to Amazon, without any relief, that I am an old man, and Amazon keeps delivering this to the bottom of my stairs, instead of to my door. Chewy.com does the same. I keep requesting that the litter be delivered to my door, but to no purpose. I am sad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Packaging is so annoying!!!
customer_reviews.text: We get 5 bags of Dr. Esleys each month on a subscription, we have lots of kitties. We used to order off chewy.com but we had repeated delivery issues with them. So we switched to Amazon, but they come double packaged with amazon. So you have the Amazon box, then inside that box is another box, which is EXTREMELY difficult to open because it is glued on all sides. No pull tab, no tape you can cut. I am a 4'11 130 lb lady, and to get 5 of these opened and stored is very tedious, I wish they would just go back to one box, or make the second inner box easier to open.
customer_reviews.author: Andumbrokhani

customer_reviews.title: Excellent litter for a 3 cat home
customer_reviews.text: Excellent litter for a 3 cat home. However, the price per 40 lb bag in August was $12.92. Today the price is greater than $28 per bag. Why? Now I will have to change to a less satisfactory product.
customer_reviews.author: JoyceT

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome
customer_reviews.text: GUYS GUYS GUYS. Are you tired of inhaling dust every time you clean the litter box? Then stop waiting to buy this stuff. My husband and I can finally breathe again since we switched to Dr. Elsey's! Our old brand claimed to be 99% dust-free, and Dr. Elsey's makes the same claim...but Dr. Elsey's actually lives up to that claim. Gone are the days of using my COVID mask to clean the litter box! Even better, I know that this has to be safer for our kitty to use than the dusty af litter that we were using before. Bonus points: the clumps stay together, and her box never smells anymore!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Pomeranz

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy tidy cat clumping litter and I thought it worked fine enough. What a surprise when I used this high quality litter. I have a very large 15# male cat who urinates LARGE volumes at 1 time. Austin Powers style peeing. Like 2 minutes straight. Ok enough on that....I am very impressed. Very absorbent, we are 2 1/2 weeks in with only scooping and not changing the litter as directed and NO odor to date. I was quite happy that my cat didn't have any issues transitioning to this new litter either.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Used to be the best...
customer_reviews.text: This cat litter used to be the best cat litter and now it is just a cheap and very heavy lousy cat litter. Definitely not worth $17.49. This is such a shame how something so great became so below average.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great but disappointed, can someone explain after buying this for a year it doubled in price. Now I have to order from Chewy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this kitty litter, have suggested it to my cat lovers, but only question why has price doubled? Paid $14 in Sept now $28.
customer_reviews.author: Ahagensen

customer_reviews.title: What cats?? I smell nothing!
customer_reviews.text: This is now my all time favorite litter. I’ve gone through just about every other type out there. Clay, pellets, ground nuts, newspaper, crystals, etc. You name it, I’ve tried it. Hands down, this has been the best in terms of odor control. It works so well, I forget I have cats! I can’t smell anything from this litter whatsoever. For folks with issues of it turning too hard at the bottom of the litter pan, you’re probably not using enough litter, which is causing the liquid to pool and solidify. I’ve never had that issue with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kale

customer_reviews.title: The best for sure!
customer_reviews.text: Hate to let out this awesome secret but I just started using this because of Cats Pride new formula is horrible. What a difference!! Cats jumped in this litter without hesitation. Clumps immediately without the urine reaching the bottom. Scoops up in chunks. This litter found a new home. Wasted 10 years scraping & cleaning wet crap off the bottom of their box. Also, this litter was rated number 1 which is why I tried it. Soooo glad I did. Happy day!
customer_reviews.author: Soutzi

customer_reviews.title: Cat lady approved
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I'm not a real cat lady. BUT I have lived with two in my life, so I know how bad cat litter can be. Dusty, on the couch, on the floor, ammonia clouds fill the room - not with this litter. Sometimes I don't even know I have two cats and one litter box. There's no smell (even if you forget to scoop for a day or two), the granules are large and don't get tracked more than a foot away from the box, and the clumping power is crazy!! I've never known a litter that can make cinderblocks from cat pee! And it's all natural! I highly recommend. I'll be using this brand forever.
customer_reviews.author: SierraH

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for free with a rebate they offered. I do not plan to buy again. This product clumped well and I appreciate that it is all natural, however, the dust was worse than any other product I have used. Instead, I buy 18 lbs from Aldi for four dollars.
customer_reviews.author: PaulyBo

customer_reviews.title: Changed formula (for the worse)
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this for about 3 years now and our most recent order was nothing like our previous bags. It barely clumps, the granules are bigger (not the sand like texture that worked) and there is no odor control whatsoever. I switched over from Fresh Step to them years ago and now I am going right back to Fresh Step Clumpable. It's a shame!
customer_reviews.author: Lorelai

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: The kitty I had 10 years ago used that Fresh Step stuff, which was perfumed & left everything covered in dust. I recently adopted an elderly kitty & did a little research before deciding on this litter. Less dust than many other brands (though not completely dust-free), definitely less expensive, and unscented. My cat's digestive tract works very well & this stuff controls the odors decently and as well (if not better) than litters tried previously. I've read many reviews on here about how the litter doesn't work as well as it used to, though IMO this stuff is still quite satisfactory. Perhaps it works less efficiently with multiple kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Great For Hardening Old Paint In Paint Cans
customer_reviews.text: I had collected a small mountain of paint cans over the years, so I purchased this 40 pound bag of cat litter to harden the old paint. This cat litter worked perfectly to harden the old paint so that I could properly dispose of it. Cat litter works the same way as paint hardener products, but is more economical in price. To harden the paint properly do the following: 1. Add equal amount of cat litter to the paint. 2. Stir the cat litter in well. 3. Allow it to absorb the paint and harden, preferably outside in the sunlight. With one 40 pound bag of cat litter, I was able to harden 22 gallon cans of paint.
customer_reviews.author: JG526

customer_reviews.title: WILL NEVER BUY THIS AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this litter. Had high hopes due to excellent reviews. The pee sinks to the bottom and forms a wet clay like texture. It is impossible to scoop. Typical plastic scoop bends. I had to use a wooden spatula to scrape the bottom. I'll NEVER purchase this again
customer_reviews.author: Patsfan101

customer_reviews.title: How am I going to use this terrible litter up?
customer_reviews.text: I cleaned the catbox for the first time today with the new litter. The clumps stuck so hard to the box, I had to use a screwdriver to dig it off so I could scoop it out. I bought it because it was supposed to be the "BEST". Wow...Any cat litter I've ever used is better than this....no doubt. I guess I'll throw it away and go back to the Breese system.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: The good & the bad
customer_reviews.text: First- it has NO scent-I like that about it. Also no dust- zero. Its extremely absorbent & the price is not bad. I have 2 cats & 2 boxes, most days i scoop twice. Today I didn't & wow heres the deal breaker for me: after not scooping my box twice as usual the clay litter had turned to the stickiest solid goo, so stuck to the bottom of the box i had to get a metal putty knife & scrape it up as my plastic scoop almost broke. It was the worst mess I've ever had to clean out of a cat box in 40 yrs! I really wanted to like this!
customer_reviews.author: curly

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is pretty awful. 2 stars only because the cats don't mind it and it does seem less dusty than my old litter. The problem is, as other have stated, it dries hard as concrete. I put in a good 2-3 inch load and urine still seeps through to the bottom where it cements itself to the pan. There's a good bit of scraping to do to get it off. So, needless to say I won't reorder. My search for a low-dust, dust-free, affordable litter goes on...
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouging Causing Exodus of Loyal Customers
customer_reviews.text: I buy this every month for our cat. The absolute most I’ve ever had to pay was $16. Now it has went from $10 a bag to almost $40? Just keep the litter for your own mess. I’ll find something else.
customer_reviews.author: JNesbitt

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible
customer_reviews.text: I am floored anyone uses this litter. It's absolutely horrible. Gave it about 2 weeks. Yes there's not much dust, but there's a lot of smell. On the brightside you won't have residue everywhere, but your entire house will smell like cat feces. All the time. It does absolutely nothing to contain any odors. I might as well train the cat to take a dump on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat litter, it's inexpensive, dust free and hypoallergenic. I have three cats and multiple liter boxes. I am constantly keeping up with them and this liter definitely is a must have. I buy the unscented but they do offer scented. My one cat is sensitive to smells so I use baking soda under the liter to help off set the smell. This is the best value for what your getting. The only negative is the bag is annoying to lug around. They do offer a box but it is smaller, I just buy a container on wheels which solves the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Fallen Soul

customer_reviews.title: Actually erases odors instead of masking with scents!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!! My fiancé and I live in a small one bedroom apartment and our cat’s litter box has been notoriously rank. I heard that this litter would do the trick and it has! Pros: - No fragrance - Genuinely erases odors - Doesn’t track as badly as other brands - Inexpensive - Easy to scoop Cons: - The box was fairly damaged when it arrived because the bag of litter was so heavy. This is likely more to do with ups than the seller. I would 100% recommended this brand over others (particularly the unscented variety) and will be using it for the foreseeable future!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Reid Evans

customer_reviews.title: Greedy not nice.
customer_reviews.text: Will not pay this price!!! This IS outrageous! Greedy not nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dlr

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, the price doubled.
customer_reviews.text: Best litter I have ever used: hard clumping, odor control, & truly dust free; but the price virtually doubled overnight. Can't afford to buy it. Too bad. UPDATE - 20180509 While the price has come down and gone back up several times since I wrote the original review, I purchased the product from another store. It still clumped well, but was as dusty as regular litter, so it appears there is an issue with product quality. Ending opinion: Excellent product when the price is right and the manufacturers are on their game. But you're rolling the dice.
customer_reviews.author: WoodsyGirl

customer_reviews.title: 99.9% dust free... when compared to a bucket full of dust.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was sick of all the litter dust my grocery-store bargain litter was kicking up. My cats had problems in the past that the Cat Attract stuff fixed, so why not try the "99.9% Dust Free" one? Yeah, as soon as I poured some out I knew it was a joke. I was greeted by an enormous, mushroom-cloud of dust doom. This stuff is arguably *worse* than grocery store (Luvsome or whatever) litter, and the only way I think they could rationalize saying "99.9% Dust Free" is if they're comparing it to 100% dust. Like a big, plastic bag full of dust. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: EvanM

customer_reviews.title: Dr. Elsey's Overpriced Cat Litter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product which, unfortunately, has a ridiculous MSRP. I don't have time to wait for it to be 60% or so off in order to compete with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: South Florida

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this litter !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This litter is a nightmare !!!!! It clumps all right !!! I had to use a screwdriver to loosen the " clump " from the bottom of the pan !!! Then the one big clump turned into 15 or so little clumps !!! You could pave a driveway with this stuff !!! I will not allow my precious animals to use this one more day. I am going to order another litter and have it shipped one day just as soon as I finish writing this !!! For your precious animals sake stay away from this. When they leave the litter box and lick their paws they are putting cement in their body !!!
customer_reviews.author: mary ann sawka o'farrell

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is clay GOLD, I tell ya'!  GOLD!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: OK, everyone says dust free, clumps perfectly etc. But this stuff TRULY is dust free. It also has no annoying perfume scent, yet it does a great job covering up animal scents. I usually clean my litter box every other day, and it is a breeze. Urine clumps into hard, dry rocks and very little of those clumps break away into smaller pieces that would typically go through the sifter with other litters. a few scoops and the litter is fresh and clean. Plus with Amazon Prime, it's free delivery right to my doorstep. Not a bad thing to say about this. And the price is great on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: AndsterManNYCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Massive price hike!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, and wanted to buy more but the price has shot up and not worth it now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John F. Mccleary

customer_reviews.title: Worry no more!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and tried this litter. The price was good... And I'm super happy with my purchase. I usually use tidy cats climbing litter and this brand actually clumps much better then tidy cats. My girls tend to pee in the same spot so it always turned to a clay mess.... Not this stuff!! Will definitely be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great litter, but don't buy it from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this litter, but I'm really frustrated by the lack of consistent pricing on Amazon. It used to be you could get the 40 lb pound bag for under $15. Then Amazon stopped selling it (except through 3rd parties) when they introduced their own AmazonBasics brand litter. The price skyrocketed to over $25 for a 40 lb pound. After everyone complained, they started selling this again and at the same price as the competitors out there ($17.50). Now, it's back up to $19 a bag. I'm totally over it and I'm not buying this product from Amazon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Agnia Yemina

customer_reviews.title: Good Product. NO DUST BUT FIRST Amazon Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. No dust so far. Dust was biggest concern with this type of litter. Other brand SCOOP AWAY was terrible for dust. However first purchase from Amazon. Noticed there was a difference in color. Gray to dark grey pieces. Also more important the cat urine is sticking to the bottom of the litter box. This was never a problem with prior bags.Was five stars now ???. Will try another bag this week Second Bag performance is back to normal. Nice ball like clumping. For some reason date stamp was missing from both bags. Dr. Elsey's customer support was great as well.
customer_reviews.author: bigfish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome litter
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through several different litter brands and this particular one is my favorite. It produces no dust, doesn't smell bad like other litters, it clumps up surprisingly well. My cat didn't seem to be bothered with the switch. I have one cat and I scoop her box daily, so I can't really say how well the odor elimination works, I don't really look for odor elimination in my litter because if it smells - I clean it. I no longer use litter though as I have trained my cat to use the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Morty

customer_reviews.title: Doubled the price in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product but in the beginning of month (Oct-2017) the price was 13.68 !!
customer_reviews.author: FerMan

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, this is not the dust free litter of years past! Its straight dust now!
customer_reviews.text: As several of the more recent negative reviews have already stated, we have been loyal customers for years and up until the past couple months would have given this cat litter 5stars. But when the marketing changed so did the quality. We are down to our last bag and will not be buying more due to the recent changes to the litter. The litter is now dust, dust, dust. When cleaning our boxes the dust literally fills the air. The cats are sneezing and are currently having eye issues. Buyer beware this is not the amazing dust free litter from years past. It is now complete dust.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Walker

customer_reviews.title: Concrete in Your Litter Box
customer_reviews.text: I am on the hunt for litter that is not dusty, clumps and absorbs oders. Dr. Easley's does all that EXCEPT to keep the litter deep enough, I have to use 40lbs a week...cleaning 2 boxes every day with 2 cats 6 to 8 pounds each. We're not talking a lynx or bobcat here...just 2 slim Siamese cats. The issue is if the urine gets to the bottom it forms a substance that could have been used as mortar for the pyramids and they would still be standing. Can't get it out of the bottom of the box once it gets stuck unless you use a chisel....not kidding.
customer_reviews.author: Philip W Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've tried this cat litter a few times and don't understand why it's so highly rated. My problems with this cat litter include: 1) Urine does not completely dry and creates a wet, clay-like material which is hard to clean out 2) It does a poor job of covering the smell of the litter box 3) It doesn't stick and clump well in general 4) Because it doesn't work well, it seems to not last as long as other brands of litter
customer_reviews.author: Alexander John

customer_reviews.title: My last purchase of "Ultra" was made in mid Oct ...
customer_reviews.text: My last purchase of "Ultra" was made in mid Oct at $13 for a 40-lb bag. Dec 24, it's listed at $27+ for the same product. Taking a Christmas advantage of the cat? Movin to other brands now.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Low Tracking, love!
customer_reviews.text: We tend to only use Dr. Elsey's Cat Litter and Arm & Hammer Clump & Seal Platinum Litter. After comparing the two, there are certainly some differences. For starters, we find that both Dr. Elsey's Dr. Elsey's and Arm & Hammer do a great job in clumping. However, cat litter tracks significantly less with Dr. Elsey's than Arm & Hammer's. The only trade-off between the two is that Arm & Hammer definitely has the leg-up in the smell department. But we have found that if you use Nature's Miracle Just for Cats Odor Destroyer Litter Powderyou can have the best of both worlds!
customer_reviews.author: RVS

customer_reviews.title: Immediately stuck to cat’s furry bottom and spread all over the house
customer_reviews.text: I will start with the disclaimer that I realize it’s my personal experience only. But this is the worst litter I have ever used for my cat. He is pretty furry (a Turkish angora mix rescue) and this litter was immediately stuck in the fur all over his butt. It was very difficult to get out and by the time we noticed he spread it EVERYWHERE. Now I have to clean my entire house AND change all the sheets because they are filled with cat litter. Just what I would like to do with two small children and a full time job! Boo, Elsie’s cat litter!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What happened to this litter?
customer_reviews.text: This used to be the best litter ever, I have used it for years. It clumped beautifully, didn't stick, no smell, low dust. This last batch was just terrible! The litter box became a sticky mess with litter that barely clumps at all, sticks to the sides and it is impossible to clean the box well. Super disappointing, will have to try a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: Onelle

customer_reviews.title: If you've got cats, you gotta have this litter.
customer_reviews.text: We have six permanent feline residents and fosters who pass through from time to time. I've had dozens of cats over decades of time. Litter has always been an issue until now. This stuff is incredible. No cloying perfumes, yet there are no kitty waste odors. The cats love it and prefer it to all other litters (really!) The stuff clumps tightly and doesn't stick to the litter pans. No dust. No tracking. I have never been able to recommend a litter until now, but I completely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Sticky, unscoopable mess.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t figure how this is so highly rated....what you end up with when your cats urinate in this litter is a thick, heavy, cement-like clump that never seems to dry and sticks to the bottom and sides of your litter pan. Impossible to scoop....ive nearly broken my scoop several times attempting to dig out the clumps. It’s unusable.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Great liter, but not worth the increased $30 per bag price point.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Hoping that is the only thing that has changed about this cat litter because I loved it as is
customer_reviews.text: Don't be alarmed when the packaging looks completely different. I called Amazon customer service and checked out the companys' direct website and confirmed packaging has changed. Hoping that is the only thing that has changed about this cat litter because I loved it as is.
customer_reviews.author: JNW82

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but still worth it in 2020
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. The Ultra has larger granules, is unscented, and has even less dust than the other types of Dr. Elsey's. A bit pricey, so watch for the rare sales on this item. There was a $3 price hike last November, and a $3 coupon at the same time. The coupon runs out in Feb 2020, so be ready for the price increase to hit after that. The new "normal" MSRP seems to now be $20/40lb (without the $3 coupon), and the days of $15/40lb bags are over. Still worth it, but I am stocking up before the coupons run out.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah King

customer_reviews.title: This is magic cat litter
customer_reviews.text: I initially didn’t care for this litter as much because it stuck to the bottom of the box like hard clay and was hard to scoop, but I’ve honestly gotten to like it a lot because it masks odor SO SO SO well! It’s kind of a fallback on my end, but I’ve noticed I’ve been forgetting to clean the cat box as often as I was because I can’t smell it and I tend to forget about it. I’ve tried a lot of brands, but this one is kind of magic. I don’t think it has much of a fragrance, if any.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Switched from A&H Slide to this!
customer_reviews.text: Was using Arm & Hammer Clump & Seal Slide & switched to this due to the price difference. I really enjoy this litter because it doesn’t have a sickening perfume smell like other litters-and it still keeps the odor way down! Highly recommend giving this one a shot if you don’t want bad smells or a really strong perfume fragrances.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Stinky litter
customer_reviews.text: Straight out if the bag I disliked this cat litter. It has a chemical smell to me that I havent noticed with my normal litter. It is "dusty" in comparision to the name brand litter that I normally use and even with regular cleaning the smell of urine and feces is strong and only gets worse. After only two weeks Ive used the entire bag of litter as Ive frequently changed out the entire litter pan to kick the odor. Im thrifty and didnt want to throw out clean litter but I can honestly say that Im thrilled to be rid of this cat litter.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: Tracks just as badly as any clay litter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this litter thinking that it was designed to track less than a clay litter. Currently, I use Tidy Cats unscented with activated charcoal bits in it. Works incredibly well, but lots of tracking. This litter tracks just as badly as Tidy Cats. The clay granules are larger in Dr. Elsey's, so now I have to wait longer to sift out the feces and urine clumps for the good litter granules to sift through the lifter. Like any litter, the urine clumps need time to set up. Overall, not a bad litter and no better or worse than Tidy Cats, but do not label as less tracking when it tracks as badly or more than other clay litters.
customer_reviews.author: dJamison

customer_reviews.title: Best CAT Litter  EVER
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 cats - and have used every single type of cat litter - my husband found this one and its amazing!! Its a big heavy bag its clumping, but here is the secret for it not to stick to bottom of cat pan - cheap cooking spray. There is NO NO ODOR at all from this litter. I do clean it out daily and the entire bag lasts one month. I use it to freshen up during the month. No more wasted money on expensive weekly cat litter - do yourself and your cats a favor and get this delivered, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This isnt regular Dr. Elsey's litter
customer_reviews.text: This litter is really bad, it doesnt clump like normal Dr. Elseys, all the pee just sinks to the bottom of the pan and sticks bad, its hard to scrape it off to clean the box, really disappointed, i used to love cleaning my cats litter box, now i dread it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did this litter change?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always used this litter and loved it. But my last bag was different. It was labeled the same but the granules were larger and now it sticks to the litter boxes like cement even though I fill my boxes over half full. I’ve never had this many issues before with this brand. Won’t be buying again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be better, past 2 months has been very dusty.
customer_reviews.text: I started ordering Precious Cat litter over a year ago to replace the old dusty litter I used to buy. This litter was amazing for the longest time, however sadly the quality seems to have slipped. The past 2 or 3 40lb bags we've ordered have been much dustier than usual. I especially notice this when scooping out poop from the litter box.... dust starts emerging from the litter box into my face which is pretty gross. I do hope Precious Cat finds out what is going on in the manufacturing process to cause this and fixes it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works
customer_reviews.text: This litter works. We use it for a litter box in an RV in the bathroom tub. We hang clothes from a rod over the tub. With all the other ‘odor free’ or ‘eliminates odors’ litter we’ve tried there were still litter smells. Dr. Elsey’s Premium Litter really works. As close to zero odor as one can get. It is pricey but it tightly clumps so that not much litter is removed during cleaning. I use less litter with Dr. Elsey’s than store brands so it goes further.
customer_reviews.author: bubba

customer_reviews.title: hard clumping - really keeps odor down
customer_reviews.text: I have nine cats and literally have tried every kind of litter out there. I like this litter for several reasons. If you scoop every day, it is real easy. The litter stays very clumped. It doesn't smell...I mean that anyone walking in my home does not smell it. It is THAT good. Not too dusty when pouring it...but you do have to hold the bag closer to the pan...then its ok. One bag will initially give you about four inches in two extra large pans...and add as needed. You don't have to totally empty a pan each time, but you must keep after it. None of my cats have any problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: abopp106

customer_reviews.title: There is no need for other cat litters.
customer_reviews.text: Last time I tried to write a review for this product they wouldn't let me. They closed the reviews (I believe) because they were unbelievable. There really is no need for the others. I get zero dust. Zero smell. Very minimal bits out of the box. I have one of those mats that catch the bits. Maybe need to shake out mat once a week. Dr. Elsey's is the best. Now make something that cleans up all the cat hair. p.s. This product is equal to the weight of five suns (a.k.a. nibbler droppings).
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, wish it was still Prime
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter. I've been using it since I brought home my kitty (after using one box of Arm & Hammer). 8 months later, it's still working great. The 40 lb bag is big enough to fill the litter box and then top off as needed (and he prefers his litterbox pretty full). It's not dusty, clumps super well, and cleans off the litterbox super well when I dump his litterbox to sanitize it about once a month. I'm super bummed that none of the Dr. Elseys products are Prime anymore. But luckily it's on Walmart, who does free two day shipping on orders over $35. :D
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: This litter sucks It tracks everywhere and it glues its self to the bottom of the litter pan, even if i make it 3in or more. The litter sticks to paws ends up everywhere. The waste sticking to the bottom causes me to scrape it off. The clumps dont stay together so chucks fall off that cant be scooped up. Almosr no odor control. After 12 hours of use.. Smelly. Terrible. Used for a month with 2 kittens
customer_reviews.author: jenii M

customer_reviews.title: Get it if you want less dust.
customer_reviews.text: This litter is the third brand I've used over the last 20 years and 4 cats. Dr. Elsey's Premium Clumping Cat litter is quite coarse , even gravelly, so I was concerned my cats wouldn't like it. They like it just fine. There is no odor nor any dust and they track less outside their boxes. You have to keep it at least 3 inches deep. I replace it entirely every 8 weeks. - Very little dust. - No litter smell; it absorbs their "business" nicely. Good stuff! - Reduced tracking and residue.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bridges

customer_reviews.title: I used to love it but...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this product for several years and think it was the best litter out there. But recently it seems like the formula may have changed. The litter no longer clumps like it did, instead it forms a gluey mess that I can’t get out of the litter box. That, coupled with a price jump from $16 to $27 and no Amazon Prime anymore means I will be searching for a new litter.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Product = Thumbs up, Price= WTH ?
customer_reviews.text: The product I like. The manipulation of the price, I do not. It clumps well and is odor free. This has almost always been available as PRIME somewhere in the mid teens. Bought one last nightt at a big box (pet) store for $20... still too high. Just bought 5 bags for ~$10 bag at CHEWY with fee shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in my purchase
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of money I paid for this litter, I expected a better quality product, especially based off of the reviews. I was disappointed. The litter clumps into a wet clay like mess and It DOES NOT absorb odor well. You are better off buying the regular run of the mill litter for your local big box store and saving your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this product so far. I was skeptical to order a new brand of liter because my cat is used to the kind we have always bought. Also, the box was SO heavy and SO hard to open lol! It was very well packaged. Almost too well. I have not noticed any odor this week since starting using it and I have been pleased with the amount of litter that comes out on her paws! I have not had to clean as much up as I used to.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Smith

product_meta.title: Dr. Elsey's Premium Clumping Cat Litter
product_meta.description: Style:Ultra| Size:40 lbA clay litter uniquely formulated combining heavy non tracking granules with medium grain. The result is an excellent clumping litter that prevents moisture from reaching the bottom of the litter box, while providing a clump that will not break apart. Ultra is perfect for multi-cat families and cat owners with sifting or mechanical litter boxes and it controls odor naturally without perfume, deodorants or chemicals.
feature_bullets: 99.9% dust free, hypo-allergenic natural litter to keep your surfaces clean and perfect for families who suffer from allergies
Hard clumping, medium-grain clay makes it the perfect clumping litter that helps prevent moisture
Multi-cat formula and superior odor control keeps your home smelling clean and fresh day in and day out
Ideal for sifting and mechanical litter boxes so it's easier for you to dispose of your kitty's waste
Forms hard clumps that don't break down making easier to scoop up and clean the box twice daily

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
